verses.verse: And when the people <WH5971> saw <WH7200> that Moses <WH4872> delayed <WH954> to come down <WH3381> from the mount <WH2022>, the people <WH5971> gathered themselves together <WH6950> unto Aaron <WH175>, and said <WH559> unto him <WH6965>, Up, make <WH6213> us gods <WH430>, which shall go <WH3212> before <WH6440> us <WH4872>; for as for this Moses, the man <WH376> that brought <WH5927> us up out of the land <WH776> of Egypt <WH4714>, we know not what is become of him <WH3045>.

And Aaron <WH175> said <WH559> unto them <WH6561>, Break off the golden <WH2091> rings <WH5141>, which are in the ears <WH241> of your wives <WH802>, of your sons <WH1121>, and of your daughters <WH1323>, and bring them unto me <WH935>.
And all the people <WH5971> brake off <WH6561> the golden <WH2091> rings <WH5141> which were in their ears <WH241>, and brought <WH935> them unto Aaron <WH175>.

And he received <WH3947> it at their hand <WH3027>, and fashioned <WH6696> it with a graving tool <WH2747>, and made <WH6213> it a molten <WH4541> calf <WH5695>: and they said <WH559>, These are thy gods <WH430>, O Israel <WH3478>, which brought <WH5927> thee up out of the land <WH776> of Egypt <WH4714>.

And when Aaron <WH175> saw <WH7200> this <WH1129>, he built an altar <WH4196> before <WH6440> it <WH175>; and Aaron made proclamation <WH7121>, and said <WH559>, To-morrow <WH4279> shall be a feast <WH2282> to Jehovah <WH3068>.

And they rose up early <WH7925> on the morrow <WH4283>, and offered <WH5927> burnt-offerings <WH5930>, and brought <WH5066> peace-offerings <WH8002>; and the people <WH5971> sat <WH3427> down to eat <WH398> and to drink <WH8354>, and rose up <WH6965> to play <WH6711>.

And Jehovah <WH3068> spake <WH1696> unto Moses <WH4872>, Go <WH3212>, get thee down <WH3381>; for thy people <WH5971>, that thou broughtest <WH5927> up out of the land <WH776> of Egypt <WH4714>, have corrupted themselves <WH7843>:

they have turned <WH5493> aside quickly <WH4118> out of the way <WH1870> which I commanded <WH6680> them <WH6213>: they have made them a molten <WH4541> calf <WH5695>, and have worshipped <WH7812> it <WH2076>, and have sacrificed unto it <WH559>, and said, These are thy gods <WH430>, O Israel <WH3478>, which brought thee up <WH5927> out of the land <WH776> of Egypt <WH4714>.
And Jehovah <WH3068> said <WH559> unto Moses <WH4872>, I have seen <WH7200> this people <WH5971>, and <WH7186>, behold, it is a stiffnecked people <WH5971>:
now therefore let me alone <WH3240>, that my wrath <WH639> may wax hot <WH2734> against them <WH3615>, and that I may consume them <WH6213>: and I will make of thee a great <WH1419> nation <WH1471>.

And Moses <WH4872> besought <WH2470> Jehovah <WH3068> his God <WH430>, and said <WH559>, Jehovah <WH3068>, why doth thy wrath <WH639> wax hot <WH2734> against thy people <WH5971>, that thou hast brought forth <WH3318> out of the land <WH776> of Egypt <WH4714> with great <WH1419> power <WH3581> and with a mighty <WH2389> hand <WH3027>?

Wherefore should the Egyptians <WH4714> speak <WH559>, saying <WH559>, For evil <WH7451> did he bring <WH3318> them forth <WH2026>, to slay them in the mountains <WH2022>, and to consume <WH3615> them from the face <WH6440> of the earth <WH127>? Turn <WH7725> from thy fierce <WH2740> wrath <WH639>, and repent <WH5162> of this evil <WH7451> against thy people <WH5971>.

Remember <WH2142> Abraham <WH85>, Isaac <WH3327>, and Israel <WH3478>, thy servants <WH5650>, to whom thou swarest <WH7650> by thine own self <WH1696>, and saidst unto them <WH7235>, I will multiply your seed <WH2233> as the stars <WH3556> of heaven <WH8064>, and all this land <WH776> that I have spoken <WH559> of will I give <WH5414> unto your seed <WH2233>, and they shall inherit <WH5157> it for ever <WH5769>.
And Jehovah <WH3068> repented <WH5162> of the evil <WH7451> which he said <WH1696> he would do <WH6213> unto his people <WH5971>.

And Moses <WH4872> turned <WH6437>, and went down <WH3381> from the mount <WH2022>, with the two <WH8147> tables <WH3871> of the testimony <WH5715> in his hand <WH3027>; tables <WH3871> that were written <WH3789> on both <WH8147> their sides <WH5676>; on the one side and on the other were they written <WH3789>.
And the tables <WH3871> were the work <WH4639> of God <WH430>, and the writing <WH4385> was the writing <WH4385> of God <WH430>, graven <WH2801> upon the tables <WH3871>.

And when Joshua <WH3091> heard <WH8085> the noise <WH6963> of the people <WH5971> as they shouted <WH7452>, he said <WH559> unto Moses <WH4872>, There is a noise <WH6963> of war <WH4421> in the camp <WH4264>.

And he said <WH559>, It is not the voice <WH6963> of them that shout <WH6030> for mastery <WH1369>, neither is it the voice <WH6963> of them that cry <WH6030> for being overcome <WH2476>; but the noise <WH6963> of them that sing <WH6031> do I hear <WH8085>.

And it came to pass <WH7126>, as soon as he came nigh unto the camp <WH4264>, that he saw <WH7200> the calf <WH5695> and the dancing <WH4246>: and Moses <WH4872>' anger <WH639> waxed hot <WH2734>, and he cast <WH7993> the tables <WH3871> out of his hands <WH3027>, and brake <WH7665> them beneath <WH8478> the mount <WH2022>.

And he took <WH3947> the calf <WH5695> which they had made <WH6213>, and burnt <WH8313> it with fire <WH784>, and ground <WH2912> it to powder <WH1854>, and strewed <WH2219> it upon <WH6440> the water <WH4325>, and made the children <WH1121> of Israel <WH3478> drink of it <WH8248>.
And Moses <WH4872> said <WH559> unto Aaron <WH175>, What did <WH6213> this people <WH5971> unto thee <WH935>, that thou hast brought a great <WH1419> sin upon them <WH2401>?
And Aaron <WH175> said <WH559>, Let not the anger <WH639> of my lord <WH113> wax hot <WH2734>: thou knowest <WH3045> the people <WH5971>, that they are set on evil <WH7451>.

For they said <WH559> unto me <WH6213>, Make us gods <WH430>, which shall go <WH3212> before <WH6440> us <WH4872>; for as for this Moses, the man <WH376> that brought us up <WH5927> out of the land <WH776> of Egypt <WH4714>, we know not what is become of him <WH3045>.

And I said <WH559> unto them <WH2091>, Whosoever hath any gold, let them break <WH6561> it off <WH5414>: so they gave it me <WH7993>; and I cast it into the fire <WH784>, and there came out <WH3318> this calf <WH5695>.
And when Moses <WH4872> saw <WH7200> that the people <WH5971> were broken loose <WH6544> (for Aaron <WH175> had let them loose <WH6544> for a derision <WH8103> among their enemies <WH6965>),

then Moses <WH4872> stood <WH5975> in the gate <WH8179> of the camp <WH4264>, and said <WH559>, Whoso is on Jehovah <WH3068>'s side <WH1121>, let him come unto me. And all the sons of Levi <WH3878> gathered themselves together unto him <WH622>.

And he said <WH559> unto them <WH559>, Thus saith Jehovah <WH3068>, the God <WH430> of Israel <WH3478>, Put <WH7760> ye every man <WH376> his sword <WH2719> upon his thigh <WH3409>, and go <WH5674> to <WH7725> and fro from gate <WH8179> to gate <WH8179> throughout the camp <WH4264>, and slay <WH2026> every man <WH376> his brother <WH251>, and every man <WH376> his companion <WH7453>, and every man <WH376> his neighbor <WH7138>.

And the sons <WH1121> of Levi <WH3878> did <WH6213> according to the word <WH1697> of Moses <WH4872>: and there fell <WH5307> of the people <WH5971> that day <WH3117> about three <WH7969> thousand <WH505> men <WH376>.

And Moses <WH4872> said <WH559>, Consecrate yourselves <WH4390> to-day <WH3117> to Jehovah <WH3068>, yea <WH3588>, every man <WH376> against his son <WH1121>, and against his brother <WH251>; that he may bestow <WH5414> upon you a blessing <WH1293> this day <WH3117>.

And it came to pass on the morrow <WH4283>, that Moses <WH4872> said <WH559> unto the people <WH5971>, Ye have sinned <WH2398> a great <WH1419> sin <WH2401>: and now I will go up <WH5927> unto Jehovah <WH3068>; peradventure <WH194> I shall make atonement <WH3722> for <WH1157> your sin <WH2403>.

And Moses <WH4872> returned <WH7725> unto Jehovah <WH3068>, and said <WH559>, Oh <WH577>, this people <WH5971> have sinned <WH2398> a great <WH1419> sin <WH2401>, and have made <WH6213> them gods <WH430> of gold <WH2091>.
Yet now <WH5375>, if thou wilt forgive their sin <WH2403>â€”; and if not <WH4229>, blot me <WH5612>, I pray thee, out of thy book which thou hast written <WH3789>.
And Jehovah <WH3068> said <WH559> unto Moses <WH4872>, Whosoever <WH834> hath sinned <WH2398> against me <WH4229>, him will I blot out of my book <WH5612>.

And now go <WH3212>, lead <WH5148> the people <WH5971> unto the place of which I have spoken <WH1696> unto thee <WH4397>: behold, mine angel shall go <WH3212> before <WH6440> thee <WH3117>; nevertheless in the day when I visit <WH6485>, I will visit <WH6485> their sin upon them <WH2403>.
And Jehovah <WH3068> smote <WH5062> the people <WH5971>, because <WH834> they made <WH6213> the calf <WH5695>, which <WH834> Aaron <WH175> made <WH6213>.
